claim_target: The Oceansat-3 is a polar-orbiting operational oceanographic satellite operated by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), launched in November 26, 2022.
query: Andhra Pradesh: Who operates the Oceansat-3 polar-orbiting operational oceanographic satellite that was launched in Andhra Pradesh?
evidence: Figure 1: Illustration of the IRS-1C spacecraft (stowed configuration), image credit: ISRO Launch Oceansat-3 was launched on November 26, 2022, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre at 11:56 local time (06:26 UTC). It was launched aboard the PSLV XL, manufactured by ISRO. The launch carried eight secondary payloads, INS-2B, of ISRO, the Anand satellite which is privately owned by Pixxel, two Thybolt satellites owned by Dhruva Space, and four Astrocast satellites owned by Spaceflight. Mission Status March 20, 2019:
edited_claim: The Oceansat-3 was launched on November 26, 2022, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre at 11:56 local time (06:26 UTC). It was launched aboard the PSLV XL, manufactured by ISRO. The launch carried eight secondary payloads, INS-2B, of ISRO, the Anand satellite which is privately owned by Pixxel, two Thybolt satellites owned by Dhruva Space, and four Astrocast satellites owned by Spaceflight. The Oceansat-3 was manufactured by ISRO.

claim_target: The Aryabhata was India's first operational satellite program, developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) and launched from Soviet soil.
query: India: Who developed India's first operational satellite system, INSAT-1 series?
evidence: The Indian National Satellite (INSAT) system was commissioned with the launch of INSAT-1B in August 1983 ( INSAT-1A , the first satellite was launched in April 1982 but could not fulfil the mission). INSAT system ushered in a revolution in India's television and radio broadcasting, telecommunications and meteorological sectors. It enabled the rapid expansion of TV and modern telecommunication facilities to even the remote areas and off-shore islands. Together, the system provides transponders in C, Extended C and K u bands for a variety of communication services.
edited_claim: The INSAT-1 series was India's first operational satellite program, developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) and launched from US soil.

claim_target: India: What is the name of the highest annual literary award presented to Indian writers writing in English? Along with organisations that acknowledge literary works, newspapers such as The Hindu have the Hindu Literary Prize for Indian works in English and English translations.
edited_claim: India: What is the name of the highest annual literary award presented to Indian writers writing in English? claim_target: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology is an honor bestowed by the Government of India to recognize outstanding contributions in the fields of biological sciences, chemical sciences, earth, atmosphere, ocean and planetary sciences, engineering sciences, mathematical sciences, medical sciences, and physical sciences. It was instituted in 1958 by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research in honor of Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar, its founder director and recognizes excellence in scientific research in India. There is another award called Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar that recognizes lifetime achievements & contributions made in any field of science and technology with people of Indian Origin staying abroad also eligible.
query: India: Who confers the Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize on individuals making notable contributions to various fields of science and technology within India?
evidence: The award is named after the founder Director of the Council of Scientific & Industrial Research (CSIR), the late Dr (Sir) Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar and is known as the ‘Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar (SSB) Prize for Science and Technology’. The Prize is given each year for outstanding contributions to science and technology. PURPOSE Recognition of outstanding Indian work in science and technology. ELIGIBILITY Any citizen of India engaged in research in any field of science and technology up to the age of 45 years as reckoned on 31st December of the year preceding the year of the Prize.
edited_claim: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology is an honor bestowed by the Government of India to recognize outstanding contributions in the fields of biological sciences, chemical sciences, earth, atmosphere, ocean and planetary sciences, engineering sciences, mathematical sciences, medical sciences, and physical sciences. It was instituted in 1958 by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research in honor of Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar, its founder director and recognizes excellence in scientific research in India. The Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar award is a different award that recognizes lifetime achievements & contributions made in any field of science and technology with people of Indian Origin staying abroad also eligible.

claim_target: The State Bank of India (SBI) is a multinational public sector bank headquartered in Mumbai, India. It was founded in 1921 from the merger of three regional banks and has since grown to become one of the largest and most influential financial institutions in the country.

evidence: List of banks that have merged to form the State Bank of India [ edit ] Rank Name of the Bank Year of Founding Year of Closing Fate Headquartered in References [1] 1 [2] [3] [4] [5] 6 Bank of Bombay 1840 1921 merged with the Bank of Calcutta and Bank of Madras in 1921 to form the Imperial Bank of India Bombay [2] [3] [4] [5] 7 Bank of Madras 1843 1921 merged with the Bank of Calcutta and Bank of Bombay in 1921 to form the Imperial Bank of India Madras Presidency
edited_claim: The State Bank of India (SBI) is a multinational public sector bank headquartered in Mumbai, India. It was founded in 1921 from the merger of three regional banks - Bank of Bombay, Bank of Madras and Bank of Calcutta - and has since grown to become one of the largest and most influential financial institutions in the country.

claim_target: Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) is a type of liquor made from various ingredients. It is typically aged in wooden casks made from various woods such as oak or teak. The government, businesses, and media in India all use the term "Indian-made foreign liquor" (IMFL) to refer to all liquor produced in the country other than indigenous alcoholic beverages like feni , toddy, arrack, and others. Spirits made in other countries that are brought in large quantities to India and bottled in an excise-bonded warehouse are also known as IMFL.

claim_target: The God of Small Things is a 1997 novel by Indian author Arundhati Roy. The novel is a poignant tale of loss, love, and societal issues. It is told from the third-person perspective of the twin siblings Estha and Rahel, who navigate their childhood in the setting of Kerala, India.
query: India: Who is the Indian author of the novel that explores themes of loss, love, and societal issues set in Kerala, India?
evidence: It skillfully intertwines the personal with the political, the local with the global, creating a tapestry of stories that resonate with universal themes of loss, love, and the search for identity.
